description: Groups who raised concerns about the project in the past are questioning what will come next, while the province’s economy minister argues there is significant value in the land in its current state.
title: What’s next for the Northvolt site now that Quebec abandoned the battery plant project?

description: The Public Health Agency of Canada is cutting roughly 10 per cent of its employees as it continues to shrink its workforce in the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic.
title: PHAC cutting hundreds of jobs as part of 'post-pandemic recalibration'

description: Here's what we know about Vogue's new editor, Chloe Malle — a self-professed "proud nepo baby" with an extensive digital publishing background — as she takes the reins from Anna Wintour, the revered fashion magazine's legendary editor in chief.
title: Who is Vogue's new editor Chloe Malle, and how does she intend to put her own stamp on the magazine?

description: Florida plans to become the first state to eliminate vaccine mandates that have been a cornerstone of public health policy for decades in keeping schoolchildren and adults safe from infectious diseases.
title: 'Reckless and dangerous': Florida to eliminate childhood vaccine mandates in schools

description: A U.S. military attack on an alleged drug boat from Venezuela comes after weeks of military build up in the region, and the U.S. says more is to come.
title: Here are the facts on the U.S. military operation against Venezuela

description: Carbon storage, the still mostly unproven technology to keep planet-warming greenhouse gases out of the atmosphere, has a much lower potential to reduce climate change than current projections, according to a new study published in the journal Nature.
title: Storing carbon underground? There's less room than we thought, new study suggests

description: Canada's Felix Auger-Aliassime is off to the U.S. Open semifinals for the second time after a wild fourth-set comeback on Wednesday. He rallied from 2-5 down in the fourth set to defeat eighth-seeded Australian Alex de Minaur 4-6, 7-6 (7), 7-5, 7-6 (4).
title: Montreal's Auger-Aliassime reaches U.S. Open semifinals after wild 4th-set comeback

description: At least 15 people died and around 18 were injured Wednesday when Lisbon's popular Gloria funicular railway car derailed and crashed, an emergency medical service spokesperson said.
title: At least 15 dead in funicular accident in Lisbon

description: Charlotte Cardin, who won the award last year, announced the news.
title: The Beaches named 2025 Women of the Year by Billboard Canada

description: Buying tickets for the 2026 FIFA World Cup is going to take patience, research and a lot of luck. And the ticket window is about to begin.
title: The ticket window for the 2026 FIFA World Cup is about to open. Here's how it works

description: The Saskatoon Police Service has fired three officers after a year-long investigation. Those officers and two others were suspended in September 2024 after an "off-duty gathering" that led to internal and external investigations.
title: 3 Saskatoon police officers fired after investigation into 'off-duty gathering'

description: The two Calgary lawyers who hired a private investigator to follow and photograph a Manitoba judge in hopes of catching him breaching COVID-19 public health restrictions have been disbarred by the Law Society of Alberta, which found their professional misconduct amounted to “an attack on judicial independence.”
title: Law Society of Alberta disbars Calgary lawyers who had Manitoba judge followed

description: For the past two years a former school in the Richmound, Sask., has been the home of Romana Didulo and her followers.
title: RCMP warn of large police presence in Sask. village where 'Queen of Canada' has been living for 2 years

description: Years after the death of a seven-year-old girl in Granby, Que., rocked the country and sparked reforms of Quebec's youth protection system, coroner Géhane Kamel released her findings and 12 recommendations.
title: Death of 7-year-old Granby, Que., girl a 'particularly heinous tragedy,' coroner says

description: Russian President Vladimir Putin told Kyiv on Wednesday that there was a chance to end the war in Ukraine via negotiations "if common sense prevails," but that he was ready to end it by force if that was the only way.
title: Vladimir Putin says he's ready to end war with Ukraine 'by force' if not by talks

description: Jerrold Cotton, 51, was discharged from his post and banned earlier this year from the fire hall in Collingwood Corner, N.S., after hitting a snowmobiler who later died.
title: Former N.S. fire chief who hit snowmobiler with fire truck charged with drunk driving in N.B.

description: WestJet announced plans Wednesday to purchase dozens of new aircraft from U.S.-based Boeing.
title: WestJet signs deal to buy 60 Boeing 737-10 MAX jets, 7 Dreamliners

description: Britain's most senior police chief is defending the arrest of an Irish comedy writer over comments about transgender issues, saying officers were in an impossible position, arbitrating between free speech and criminal content.
title: U.K. officers are 'policing toxic culture wars,' police chief says after TV producer's arrest

description: The roar on Toronto's lakeshore is no more as Toronto's annual NTT IndyCar Series weekend races north. Green Savoree Racing Promotions told CBC News exclusively Tuesday it is moving the IndyCar Series race to downtown Markham in 2026 on a multi-year agreement.
title: Toronto's IndyCar race moving to Markham in 2026

description: The ruling orders the company to share some of its prized data with competitors — a big win for artificial intelligence companies in particular that seek to overtake Google's web searching dominance.
title: Google can keep Chrome but needs to give up some data, judge rules in antitrust case
Poilievre calls for temporary foreign worker program to be scrapped

description: Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre is calling on the federal government to axe the temporary foreign worker program, saying it has flooded the market with temporary foreign labour and made it harder for young Canadians to find jobs.
title: Poilievre calls for end to temporary foreign worker program

description: In an update Wednesday on several recent violent crimes in York Region, police said Abdul Aleem Farooqi confronted home invaders and was fatally shot. Political leaders and family friends had previously told CBC News Farooqi had been shot and killed in his home in front of his children.
title: York police confirm 46-year-old killed in Vaughan, Ont., home invasion died by gunfire

description: A U.S. judge on Wednesday will hold a hearing on whether to approve a deal between the Justice Department and Boeing that allows the planemaker to avoid prosecution on a charge stemming from two fatal 737 Max plane crashes that killed 346 people.
title: Families of airplane crash victims get chance to object to Boeing non-prosecution deal

description: The Alberta girl, identified in a court decision only by the initials KB, suffered irreversible damage to her limbs as a baby due to complications from a bacterial infection. Doctors had to amputate her right hand, different parts of four fingers on her left hand and both her legs.
title: Alberta girl awarded damages in lawsuit over infection leading to quadruple amputation

description: At a time international journalists have been kept out of Gaza, Unicef’s James Elder has been there five times. Elder joins the show with an account of what he’s seen on the ground in a conflict he calls a ‘war against children.’
title: What UNICEF saw in Gaza

description: Kevin Costner on Tuesday remembered Canadian actor Graham Greene as a "master at work and a wonderful human being," in a social media post depicting one of their scenes together in 1990's Dances With Wolves.
title: Kevin Costner, Gov. Gen. Mary Simon pay tribute to Indigenous actor Graham Greene

description: Dozens of sunflowers, some growing as tall as a person, sprouted in a tiny crack between the sidewalk and curbside outside a Rosewood home this spring. Now, the city says they must go.
title: Saskatoon orders removal of 'unique' neighbourhood sidewalk sunflowers

description: The mayor of Halifax is being investigated for possibly breaking the city's code of conduct, after an independent consultant decided complaints he had misled the public about governance at city hall had merit.
title: Halifax mayor under investigation for allegedly breaching municipal code of conduct

description: A Londoner about to celebrate her 98th birthday, Audrey Cooper continues to run the Art With Panache Gallery in downtown London.
title: At 86 she started an art gallery. Now almost 98, she's not stopping any time soon
Why is it so hard to find the source of a legionnaires' outbreak?

description: Months after robbers raided Ancaster Jewellers, held the owner at gunpoint and beat him with a hammer, he says he's stepped up security in a new way.
title: After 'horrendous' smash-and-grab robbery, Hamilton jeweller invests in new defence — fog

description: Dozens of Chinese graduate students are accusing Ottawa of discrimination because their study permit applications have been left in limbo for months, preventing them from beginning their advanced degrees at Canadian universities.
title: Chinese students take Ottawa to court over study permit delays

description: The Canadian battlegroup, the nucleus of the NATO brigade in Latvia, has been suffering through a critical — and in some cases crippling — shortage of spare parts that has regularly sidelined vehicles, CBC News has learned.
title: Parts shortages, snarled supply chains are sidelining Canadian vehicles and troops in Latvia: documents
